wikipedia_page.main: Muriel Edith Nichol JP (born 2 Feb 1893 Wilmslow, Cheshire - died 28 May 1983 Welwyn Garden City, Hertfordshire), née Wallhead, was a Labour Party politician in England.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1945 United Kingdom general election

response: His daughter Muriel Nichol was also a Labour politician, and served as MP for Bradford North from 1945 to 1950.

At the 1945 general election he stood unsuccessfully in the Bradford East constituency in West Yorkshire, losing in that year's landslide by a wide margin to the Labour Party candidate Frank McLeavy.  After boundary changes, he stood at the 1950 general election in the neighbouring Bradford North, where he unseated the Labour MP Muriel Nichol.
*Muriel Nichol (née Wallhead, 1893–1983), English politician, daughter of R. C.
